page.title: 15OVERSLEY WOOD
page.content: Oversley Wood is owned by the Forestry Commission. It is a mixed forest with trees like the Western Red Cedar, grown for quick growth and others like Oak and Ash grown for slower maturity. Oversley is part of ancient forest of Arden, which stretched across west warwickshire. Then the trees were mostly Oak and Ash. The Oak wood was used for building houses and the bark sent to Evesham for tanning leather. the ash was used for farm carts, tools, handles and hurdles. Today the wood is open to the public and a trail has been arranged with various stops to show all different aspects of the wood. To gain entry you contact the head forester at Wootton Wawen. The various stops ask you to use all your senses and make you fully aware of your surroundings.
